results.title: Agonia = Agony
results.creator_credit: Elem Klimov, Semion Kutikov and Mosfilm
results.brief_description:
In the final days of the Romanov regime (1613-1917), the ‘mad monk’ Rasputin wields power at the court. He is portrayed as a man completely out of touch with the people and political reality, immersed in sexual decadence and the lascivious manipulation of others. The relationship of Rasputin, the Czar and the Empress are explored in this historical drama, with the latter two falling under Rasputin’s spell. Klimov takes a docu-drama approach mixing colour re-enactments of historical events with simulated black and white newsreel footage. This film was completed in 1975 but due to its sympathetic portrayal of Czar Nicholas II, was not released until 1981

Credits: Producer, Semion Kutikov ; director, Elem Klimov ; writer, Semyon Lungin, Ilya Nusinov ; photography, Leonid Kalashnikov ; music, Alfred Shnitke.
Cast: Velta Linei, Alisa Freindlikh, Anatoly Romashin, Alexey Petrenko, A. Romantsov, S. Muchenikov.

results.title: Agnes, Maude & Pearly too
results.creator_credit: Erica Glynn, Alice Jacques, Charles Mitchell and AFTRS
results.brief_description: Two sisters meet up to play pokies on their deceased sister’s favourite pokie machine before scattering her ashes. Shortly afterward, their grief compounds and the truth of the past is revealed and confronted.

results.title: Aging
results.creator_credit: Peter Jordon, McGraw-Hill Films and CRM Educational Films
results.brief_description: Examines some popular, although often mistaken, attitudes towards the aged and their places in life. Discusses two major theories: the activity theory and leisure world with Dr Vern Bengston of USC and the disengagement theory.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Jordon, McGraw-Hill Films and CRM Educational Films

results.title: Agility and tumbling
results.brief_description: The gymnastics performance of a class of ten to twelve year old girls. The girls do simple basic agility such as forward rolls, backward rolls, headstands, headstands and cartwheels, then gradually progress to combinations of these as well as handsprings, one handed cartwheels and round-offs.

results.title: Ageing Parents
results.brief_description: Many children regard their parents as a burden. This thought-provoking program explores what it feels like to get older. Elderly parents, their children and teenagers talk about how they relate to each other, their expectations and ways of keeping the lines of communication open - before it’s too late.

results.title: Ageing
results.brief_description: This informative video looks at the physical aspects of growing old and explores some of the mysteries of ageing. It looks at the correlation between age and activity and shows that people who treat their bodies with respect can be as active and energetic as people half their age.
results.description: This informative video looks at the physical aspects of growing old and explores some of the mysteries of ageing. It looks at the correlation between age and activity and shows that people who treat their bodies with respect can be as active and energetic as people half their age.

results.title: Age of the mountain man
results.brief_description: Re-enacts the hardships of two trappers and their Indian scout during a few days in 1840. The mountain men trap beaver and trade pelts with friendly Indians. After contact with hostile Indians they reconsider their way of life. Gives the flavour of a transitional period in the westward expansion of the US.

results.title: Age of the Buffalo
results.brief_description: Uses paintings of the mid 19th Century to depict the era of the North American Plains Indian and the vast herds of buffalo that once grazed on the prairie.

results.title: Age of terror
results.brief_description: Comprehensive and well-researched documentary about the history of terrorism tracing it from to the 1940s, to the present day. Using archival footage, and a slew of enlightening interviews the filmmakers address the methodologies, ideologies and outcomes of terrorism, tackling an array of worldwide historical events. “In the name of liberation” This segment covers the wars fought, over the decades, in the name of liberating homelands. Topics covered include the conflict in Palestine, the war in Algiers against the French, the Malay versus the British, the South African conflict and the ANC, and the bombings in Ireland. “In the name of the revolution” Examines guerrilla warfare of the 20th century and clashes in Cuba, Peru, Italy and Germany in the name of revolution. Key players in these conflicts are interviewed, explaining their motivations at the time, with many reflecting upon what those outcomes mean to them now. “In the name of God” Examines acts of terrorism committed in the name of religion. Conflicts covered include the 1970 hijacking of several airplanes, in order to draw attention to Palestine - regarded as the world’s first media terrorist event. Topics covered include: September 11, suicide bombers, Osama Bin Laden, the 1997 terrorism attack in Egypt, Islam, Al Qaeda, Jihad, Zionism, issues in the Middle East and Palestine, conflicts in the Arab world, battles between Jews and Muslims, and militant groups that dominate terrorism. “In the name of the state” Examines the issues of state sponsored terror. What happens when governments commit acts of terrorism and torture against their own people? Looks at the situation in Argentina in the 1970s, when state sanctioned terror saw the disappearance and torture of innumerable citizens, many of whom were never seen again. One interviewee, a survivor of torture describes how pregnant women were made to give birth under captivity only for the babies to be given to military families. Also looks at Iranian state sponsored terrorism.
